Articles.Content:
I just got this short game on sale called Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons. I only started it, but it has a very interesting setup.  You control two characters at the same time. One with WASD and the spacebar to interact, the other with the arrow keys and right ctrl.

 

It would be a bit awkward, but if KSP was set up so that one aircraft flies with the standard controls and a second flies with arrow keys and right shift and control for throttle, that would make for some interesting possibilities.  I fly one handed as it is, so there is no reason I could not learn to fly two handed.  And if the planes go out of range of each other, you could create a split screen setup?

 

It's probably too clumsy to apply to KSP,  but it is an interesting thought....

Splitscreen multiplayer lol.

It might be possible to set up a multiplayer server using the multiplayer mods and connect two instances of ksp in windows mode to it in different KSP folders with different game settings for key control. The issue is I don't know that you could make it respond to both at once.
